title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-3.4 - Advance notice to carrier by employees not required; advance notice to carrier by individual business owner
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-3.4 - Advance notice to carrier by employees not required; advance notice to carrier by individual business owner

State Regulations
(a) The employee is not responsible for providing advance notice of foreseeable
leave to the carrier beyond the requirements stated in filing a request for
paid family leave as set forth in section
380-5.1
of this Part and section
217
of the Workers' Compensation Law. (b) An individual business owner who has
purchased family leave coverage must give 30 days notice to his, her, or their
carrier and otherwise comply with the provisions of this Subpart. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
380-3.4

Adopted

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
